definition: to rub/to grind/to polish/to sharpen/to wear down/to die out/to waste time/to pester/to insist

sentences.english: The old lady is pottering around in the garden.
sentences.chinese: 那老太太在花园了磨洋工。

sentences.english: He always lies down in the workshop.
sentences.chinese: 他在车间里总是磨洋工。

sentences.english: When the boss found Ron loafing on the job, he sent him packing.
sentences.chinese: 当老板发现罗恩在磨洋工，他马上把他辞掉了。

sentences.english: The boss told the workers not to dawdle over their work.
sentences.chinese: 老板告知工人不要磨洋工。

sentences.english: Slacking is the one thing he cannot abide.
sentences.chinese: 做事磨洋工是他容忍的一件事。

sentences.english: They can not kill their time every day.
sentences.chinese: 他们不可以整日价的磨洋工。

sentences.english: Are they loafing, spending most of their time having tea breaks?
sentences.chinese: 他们是在磨洋工，把大部分时间花在喝茶上吗？

sentences.english: That fellow was fired because he had loafed on the job.
sentences.chinese: 那个家伙因为磨洋工而被解雇了。

sentences.english: Some workers are loitering over their work.

definition: to slacken off in one's work/to go slow (as a form of strike)
erhua variant of 幹活|干活[gan4 huo2]
see 做一天和尚撞一天鐘|做一天和尚撞一天钟[zuo4 yi1 tian1 he2 shang5 zhuang4 yi1 tian1 zhong1]
pinyin: dang1 yi1 tian1 he2 shang5 zhuang4 yi1 tian1 zhong1

definition: lit. as a monk for today, toll today's bell (idiom)/fig. to do one's job mechanically/to hold a position passively
pinyin: zuo4 yi1 tian1 he2 shang5 zhuang4 yi1 tian1 zhong1

definition: to resort to tricks/to act in a slippery way/to try to evade (work, responsibility)
to dilly-dally on the pretence of being ill/to malinger
to make a living doing manual labor/to give sth all one's got
to shy away from work/to get by without attending duty
more hands than needed (idiom); too many cooks spoil the broth
